oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Special Order No. 1 from the headquarters of the 30th Tennessee Regiment in Dalton, Georgia

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Military orders
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Special Order No. 1 from the headquarters of the 30th Tennessee Regiment of Volunteers in Dalton, Georgia, requiring the examination of and report on a lot of clothing, including jackets, pants, caps, hats, drawers, shirts, and socks. It includes an accompanying report from the appointed Board of Survey stating that several of the items are too small or otherwise unfit for use.

Special orders are comprised of commands related to a specific action to be taken within the units of troops specified in the order. Orders can consist of movements, actions, and transfers. The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. A Board of Survey is comprised of officers appointed and charged with the task of assigning responsibility for loss, damage, or destruction of U. S. government property.
